title: How to Get Rid of Mold and Mildew in Shower Grout

steps.title: Make a mold-killing solution.
steps.content: Make a mold-killing solution. Pour ½ cup (120 ml) of vinegar into 1 quart (1 liter) of warm water. Use distilled white vinegar. Then mix in ¼ cup (59 ml) of borax. Mix the ingredients together in a pitcher until they are well-combined and the borax is completely dissolved. Alternatively, you may use 3 percent hydrogen peroxide. However, do not dilute it with water or mix it with borax. Instead, use straight peroxide, or mix 1 part peroxide to 1 part vinegar. [1] X Research source You can purchase borax from your local pharmacy or grocery store. Reader Poll: We asked 356 wikiHow readers which chemical solution they prefer to use to clean mold, and only 10% of them said 3% hydrogen peroxide. [Take Poll] While peroxide can be effective at removing mold, other cleaners may work better.

steps.title: Fill a spray bottle with the solution.
steps.content: Fill a spray bottle with the solution. Then spray the mold with the solution. Make sure to spray a generous amount of the solution onto the affected areas in your shower. You may have some solution leftover. As you clean the mold, re-fill the bottle as needed.

steps.title: Let the solution set for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.content: Let the solution set for 10 to 15 minutes. Depending on how much mold you have, you may need to let the solution set for longer like 30 minutes to an hour.

steps.title: Scrub the mold away.
steps.content: Scrub the mold away. Use a scrub brush to do this. Scrub the mold in a vigorous back and forth motion until all of it is removed. For small crevices, use a toothbrush to scrub the mold. As you scrub, you may need to spray more solution onto the affected areas to clean them thoroughly.

steps.title: Wipe the area clean.
steps.content: Wipe the area clean. Use a clean, dry towel to do this. Wipe until all the debris and mold are removed. [2] X Expert Source Mike Kapur Certified Mold Assessor & Home Inspector, Sonic Home Inspections Expert Interview. 19 August 2020. Do not rinse the area with water because any remaining borax will help keep your shower clean for a longer period of time. Alternatively, you may use a vacuum to clean away debris and mold. However, make sure to use a HEPA filter; this type of filter can collect and contain mold spores.

steps.title: Dry your shower.
steps.content: Dry your shower. Use a clean, dry towel to do this. Make sure the areas in your shower that collect and grow mold are thoroughly dried. [3] X Expert Source Ashley Matuska Professional Cleaner Expert Interview. 15 April 2019.

steps.title: Mix 3 parts baking soda to 1 part water to form a paste.
steps.content: Mix 3 parts baking soda to 1 part water to form a paste. Mix the baking soda and water in a bowl until they are well-combined. You are looking for a mixture with a toothpaste-like consistency. [4] X Research source If the mixture is too thin, then just add more baking soda until a thick paste forms.

steps.title: Apply the paste onto the stained areas with a sponge.
steps.content: Apply the paste onto the stained areas with a sponge. Let the paste set for 10 to 15 minutes. For tough stains, let the paste set for longer like 30 minutes to an hour. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Scrub the stains.
steps.content: Scrub the stains. Use a scrub brush to do this after the paste has set for the allotted time. Scrub in a vigorous back and forth motion until they are gone. Use a toothbrush to clean small crevices. [6] X Research source If the stains remain, then you may need to repeat steps one through three again.

steps.title: Wipe the area clean with a damp towel.
steps.content: Wipe the area clean with a damp towel. Wipe until any and all paste, debris and grime are removed. Then use a clean, dry towel to wipe your shower down until it is completely dry. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on your ventilation fan.
steps.content: Turn on your ventilation fan. Make sure to do this while you are taking a shower or bath. [8] X Expert Source Ashley Matuska Professional Cleaner Expert Interview. 15 April 2019. Also, leave it on for an additional 30 minutes after you get out of the shower. [9] X Research source If you do not have a ventilation fan, then keep your bathroom windows open during and after your shower.

steps.title: Spray down your shower with a water-vinegar solution.
steps.content: Spray down your shower with a water-vinegar solution. Do this after you shower three to five times a week to prevent mold growth. Mix equal parts water and vinegar, and fill a spray bottle labeled “shower spray” with the solution. [10] X Research source Keep the spray bottle handy in your shower or bathroom. If you have children, make sure to keep the spray bottle out of reach.

steps.title: Wipe down your shower with a dry towel.
steps.content: Wipe down your shower with a dry towel. [11] X Expert Source Ashley Matuska Professional Cleaner Expert Interview. 15 April 2019. Do this after you shower five to seven times a week. Make sure to wipe down and dry your shampoo bottles, cleansers, toys, and other objects in the shower as well. [12] X Research source Keep a designated towel handy in your bathroom for this specific purpose.
